page.title: 01Gazeteer
page.content: Banchory is in{Kincardine and Deeside {district}-18 miles East of{Aberdeen.} It is an attractive town(population 7000) situated on the{River Dee}and surrounded by wooded hills including the{Hill of Scolty}where the{Burnett {family}built a tower which is visible for miles. Much of the present town dates back to the early 19th century although evidence of settlement has been found dating back to Neolithic times. Over the last ten years new houses have been built on the outskirts of Banchory particularly in the N. and E. of the town.The growth being due to the proximity of Aberdeen-centre of the oil industry. Banchory has a small shopping area,a primary school with a roll of 720 and a secondary school with a roll of 580.
